MAYORALTY OF NEW ORLEANS. >
City Hall, October 15th, 1856. /
To the Officers-and Men of the Police
of the City of Neiv Orleans :
The object of placing a copy of this small volume in
the hands of every Policeman, is, that he shall have in
his possession, the means whereby he can become acquainted with the duties lie is required to perform.
The instructions as to the legal powers and duties of
Policemen should be carefully studied by every member
of the Department, for without a thorough and intimate knowledge of these Rules, Policemen will be fre-
qucntlj^d into error, and be the means, perhaps, of
', ingi el si .■■,1,1 upon the Department.
In preparing a work of this kind, it is impossible to
provide for every emergency that may arise, therefore
it will be required of every Policeman, not only to adhere strictly to the Rules laid down here, but also to
conform to such other orders, as may be issued from
time to time by the Mayor or Chief of Police.
